data.title: Friendly and Delicious Italian food
data.text: The place was busy, servers were hustling. Our server was upbeat, friendly, and understanding when we were slow to order and had lots of questions. Food tasted fresh and delicious, from the greens & beans appetizer, to the Chicken Milanese. No one in our group was in love with the Tiramisu, too mushy and not enough distinct flavor, or the Cognac chicken (flavors inside the dish seemed to clash a bit), but our group's overall feeling and opinion of the meal and the place itself was very good.

data.title: Birthday Dinner
data.text: The restaurant was very loud and not good for conversation.  The waitress was attentive and friendly.  The filet mignon was ok, but I've had much better.  The pasta was good.

data.title: Great family dining!
data.text: Lived up to reputation with a varied menu so everyone found something to like. From a great chicken scaperella to a nice salmon special. Very attentive service. Maybe a bit to soon removing dishes but overall a good experiance. A bit loud when crowded but nice atmosphere all around.

data.title: Excellent lunch
data.text: Stopped by for lunch before a movie.Excellent service.  Lunch portions generous, eggplant rating always great,

data.title: Worth the visit
data.text: We have eaten here many times, are always happy with the delicious food, and we especially enjoy the outdoor live entertainment in the summer.

data.title: Family weekend Dinner.
data.text: Friendly service, good food and Gluten Free Pasta too! Came here for dinner while visiting our son for family weekend at a nearby college. The ambiance was very nice, you should make a reservation on the weekends as it is a popular downtown place.

data.title: Great overall
data.text: Great ambiance, friendly staff & good food make this a great spot for dinner.  This was my second visit here while traveling for business. The bartender suggested the peartini which was fantastic!  I love the Italian nachos & the antipasto plate. I had a pasta special that was really good as well. We finished dinner with the gelato cake & pumpkin martini.

data.title: Excellent Italian Food And Excellent Service
data.text:
We had a very good pre-show dinner here before heading across the street to Proctors Theatre.

The bread was crunchy on the outside, but soft on the inside, and was served with olive oil and balsamic vinegar. When we were offered more bread, the olive oil and balsamic was also replaced, which is often not the case.

I had the chicken parmigiana and my wife had a nightly special that included some type of beef. Both were excellent, as was the service.

We had the tiramisu and the gelato cake for dessert. My only suggestion would be that the gelato cake should be left at room temperature a bit before being served, as the gelato was frozen so solidly that the flavors were somewhat subdued.

Overall, we really enjoyed our dinner, and I highly recommend Johnny's.

data.title: Great Italian food!
data.text: Ate dinner there last night. Should have made reservations because we would have to wait 3 hours or eat at the bar. We chose to eat at the bar. Food was great and service was good. We were personally greeted by the owner (or manager)...nice touch.

data.title: Johnny's....That's Mr Johnny to yous guys...
data.text:
But seriously, this is a really great place. I was in a bit of a hurry today so I sat at the bar. Wish I had gotten the bartender's name because she was a most excellent host. I ordered my usual, Chicken Parmesan. Served just like I want it...filling up the plate with a small portion of paste to make it look nice. Most places over cook the chicken, probably because it has to be so thin. These guys do it right so the chicken was tender and moist. The best, really best part, about eating at Johnny's is the combination of atmosphere, price point, and friendly service. 

This is a must see and do for downtown Schenectady. It's right across the street from Proctor's Theater so come early if you're there for a show and enjoy a great meal beforehand. You won't be disappointed.

Rick

data.title: Will Definetly return
data.text:
It is so nice that Schenectady has such a great restaurant downtown.  Johnny's has attentive staff, excellent food and generous portions, and a great atmosphere.

Menu offers many unique dishes and traditional italian as well.

Everyone in our group of 12 enjoyed their apps,meals and dessert which is a rare occasion when all 12 are happy!

data.title: Best pasta anywhere.
data.text: Love the drinks, love the outdoor dining, love the appetizers,  and LOVE the homemade pasta.  It melts in your mouth.  Sauces are exceptional too.

data.title: Excellent downtown choice
data.text: While in downtown Schenectady, NY, Johnny's Italian Restaurant is an excellent choice. Highly recommended by the front staff of our hotel and it was worth it. Two in our party. We both ordered Caesar salad, with a choice of having anchovies or not. Husband had veal parmesan, which was excellent. I ordered the veal chop, which was topped with a small mesculan salad and chopped tomatoes. It, too, was excellent. Both dinner portions were very large and filling on their own so I highly recommend not even ordering an appetizer. Also, if I had known there would be so much salad topping the chop for its presentation, I wouldn't have had the Caesar. The array of desserts being served at a nearby table looked absolutely amazing but we were way to full to get one. Be forewarned...this is a very popular, busy restaurant and the noise level was very high, so if you're looking for a nice quiet place to dine, best to check out other restaurant choices. Otherwise, Johnny's is an excellent choice. Would have given it 5 stars if it were not for the ear-splitting noise.

data.title: Highly Recommended
data.text: Heard great things and finally made it to Johnny's for dinner Saturday night. An absolutely amazing place! Great, relaxing atmosphere, terrific staff, excellent service and phenomenal food. Treated like family. Will definitely be back.

data.title: Absolutely THE BEST!
data.text: My husband travels to this part of NY pretty often and he swears by Johnny's and now I see why.  We took our child to look at Union College and we made reservations for dinner at Johnny's.  What a fabulous treat -- the ambiance is fun and the food was fantastic.  I had an eggplant and tomato dish that was excellent;  I can close my eyes and taste it even now!  I highly recommend this wonderful restaurant and I strongly suggest you make reservations.

data.title: Best Italian food
data.text: Awesome food. We have never had a bad meal here.  Love their chop salad and the marsala is the best .  They make their own pasta which is delicious.  Wait staff is very friendly.

data.title: noisey
data.text: pretty good food but its way too noisey for my tastes,decent menu selection.very good drinks good service

data.title: Excellent Service Good Food
data.text: The first time we went there it was late dinner and the acoustics were awful. The last time we went we were earlier and not so noisy. The service by Nadia was excellent. The Rib Eye special was very good for the price.

data.title: So good food, slow kitchen
data.text:
Four of us went for dinner. Johnny's is fun, upbeat, and the food is very good. Italian nachos and beans and greens are a must have. 

My chicken milanese was good, a tad dry but not bad. Very crispy. Salad was included and the side veggies were great. For $17, a good value. Husband had haddock francese. Excellent. And our companions enjoyed eggplant rollitini and short ribs. 

Our server was great..very professional and friendly..very sharp and knew the menu by heart (Krissy).  However, the kitchen was slow and our meal, from apps to entree, even bread, came out slowly. We were having a nice time anyway, but I'm glad we weren't in a hurry.

data.title: Great! Great! Fresh Pasta is better than Theater!
data.text: I went in before a show and regretted having to leave. Very friendly casual place with outstanding chicken parm and pasta barese. Giant chocolate black out cake satisfied four of us.  Plenty of food without breaking the bank!
